channel.title: Shipping a Working Mumble VoIP
channel.description:
The good news is mumble supports TCP, works well in high latency environments, packaged for Debian and successfully tested in the past.
Here's a few ideas for configuring it for easy use so it can be shipped one day:
* Somehow create a general purpose wrapper (reusable elsewhere) that generates an ephemeral onion service and relays back the chosen address to WS users for sharing. That will save the user from having to learn how to configure onion services by themselves.
* Figure out a way to run it safely with AORTA since its noted to leak DNS requests and does not respond to changes in its network settings. Alternatively DNS requests should be blocked for it specifically since its of zero benefit in this usecase. https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/5699#comment:14 Some of the concerns in the comment and wiki page aren't really relevant to us since we don't care about cross platform or non transproxied systems.
***
A summary of settings that our wiki instructions are based on:
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/wiki/doc/TorifyHOWTO/Mumble

item.title: Shipping a Working Mumble VoIP
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
A mumble server will be part of a wider framework on TAILS to make software easily configurable called TAILS server.

https://tails.boum.org/blueprint/tails_server/
https://tails.boum.org/blueprint/VoIP_support/
https://labs.riseup.net/code/issues/5688

GitLab

Sign in

GitLab.com


GitLab

Sign in

GitLab.com

I see room for collaboration and adoption of their software like with onion-grater.

Read full topic

item.title: Shipping a Working Mumble VoIP
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
The good news is mumble supports TCP, works well in high latency environments, packaged for Debian and successfully tested in the past.

Here’s a few ideas for configuring it for easy use so it can be shipped one day:

  • Somehow create a general purpose wrapper (reusable elsewhere) that generates an ephemeral onion service and relays back the chosen address to WS users for sharing. That will save the user from having to learn how to configure onion services by themselves.

  • Figure out a way to run it safely with AORTA since its noted to leak DNS requests and does not respond to changes in its network settings. Alternatively DNS requests should be blocked for it specifically since its of zero benefit in this usecase. https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/5699#comment:14
    Some of the concerns in the comment and wiki page aren’t really relevant to us since we don’t care about cross platform or non transproxied systems.

A summary of settings that our wiki instructions are based on:

https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/wiki/doc/TorifyHOWTO/Mumble
